data: JS Perf Wins & New Node.js Features with Yagiz Nizipli

Yagiz Nizipli talks about his involvement with Node.js, implementing .env, how he finds areas to improve in performance, the happy path vs the hot path, and new features coming to Node.js.

Show Notes

  • 00:32 Welcome
  • 01:01 Introducing Yagiz Nizipli
  • 02:21 What is your involvement in Node.js?
  • 03:27 Implementing .env
  • 07:03 Why was 20,000 lines of C required?
  • 11:00 How do you begin to find performance issues?
  • 15:17 How do you measure improvements?
  • 26:27 The happy path vs the hot path
  • 27:36 Is Rspack ready for prime time?
  • RSpack
  • 28:47 Bundle Size VS runtime perf? Whats more important?
  • 30:51 What's it like working on a large project like Node?
  • 38:26 Will Node ever get TypeScript support?
  • 40:22 What are loaders?
  • 44:24 Node.js is getting a config file?
  • 51:37 Sick Picks

Sick Picks

  • Oxc
  • @Boshen_c

Shameless Plugs

  • @yagiznizipli

Hit us up on Socials!

Syntax: X Instagram Tiktok LinkedIn Threads

Wes: X Instagram Tiktok LinkedIn Threads

Scott:X Instagram Tiktok LinkedIn Threads
Node.js Performance Wins with TC39 Member Yagiz Nizipli
Yagiz Nizipli discusses Node.js performance improvements he has contributed, optimization techniques, complexities around URLs and factors enabling future TypeScript support.
Yagiz has been involved with Node.js performance
Yagiz focuses on Node.js performance improvements
Common Node.js optimizations involve reducing serialization costs between JS and C++
Node.js is shifting towards including more developer experience features like dotenv
The URL parser is a complex 20,000 line state machine implemented in C++
The URL specification is very complex with thousands of edge cases
Finding performance wins in Node.js by optimizing frequently used fundamental parts
Caring about performance is a mindset independent of specific code instances
Avoiding inefficient operations like unnecessary copying in hot code paths
Knowing Node.js internals helps reason about costs of operations
Yagiz replaced Sentry's webpack with faster Rust-based esbuild
Happy path optimization targets positive execution path
Node.js loaders will enable TypeScript support without vendoring TS
A Node.js config file is being added to configure flags externally
Hear TC39 and Node.js committee member @yagiznizipli explain critical but overlooked performance wins contributed to Node core!
Node.js optimizer @yagiznizipli blows minds sharing how complex URL parsing is under the hood with a 20,000 line state machine!
Node.js performance evangelist @yagiznizipli schools us on why caring about #perf is a mindset - avoid inefficient ops like copying!
@yagiznizipli explains how Node.js loaders can enable #TypeScript parsing without vendoring TS code!
.@yagiznizipli walks us through Node.js config file being added to configure flags externally for easier debugging and profiling!
Learn how @yagiznizipli replaced @sanity_io's webpack with faster Rust-based @esbuild_net for massive build speed gains!
